intro: Labourdonnaisia discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its small, white flowers and basal leaves that are arranged in a rosette. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
